content: Some compiler consumers like Prusti and MIRAI need information about aliasing that is available in the borrow checker. This pull request adds a way for compiler consumers to access inputs of any query. However, most of the borrow checker functions and structures are private and cannot be accessed. @nikomatsakis would it be fine with you (in principle, I am not sure yet when I will be able to start working on this) if I refactored do_mir_borrock so it was possible to access region IDs and Polonius input facts?
